solution_line_template: Dorothy paid ${payment_for_coins} for {coins_sold_in_L1} gold coins so each gold coin is worth ${payment_for_coins}/{coins_sold_in_L1} = $<<{payment_for_coins}/{coins_sold_in_L1}={value_per_gold_coin}>>{value_per_gold_coin}

The Tavern master originally had ${initial_gold_value} worth of gold coins which is ${initial_gold_value}/${value_per_gold_coin} = <<{initial_gold_value}/{value_per_gold_coin}={initial_number_of_gold_coins}>>{initial_number_of_gold_coins} gold coins

He gave {coins_given_to_dorothy} out of {initial_number_of_gold_coins} gold coins to Dorothy so he now has {initial_number_of_gold_coins}-{coins_given_to_dorothy} = <<{initial_number_of_gold_coins}-{coins_given_to_dorothy}={remaining_gold_coins}>>{remaining_gold_coins} gold coins left
